result: Question 121) Flu, I think between sneezing in how the word flu came to us after a series of contagion between languages. He departed from Italy in 1743 the influenza epidemic that spread throughout Europe, besides the virus itself, two viral words: the Italian Influenza and the French Grippe. The first was a term derived from the influence of medieval Latin, which meant "influence of stars on men." The second was only the nominal form of the gripper verb, that is, "grab". It is supposed to refer to violent mode as the virus takes over the infected organism.
